  Run a single prompt in non-interactive mode and exit.

  The prompt can be provided as arguments or piped from stdin.


  USAGE


    crush run [prompt...] [--flags]


  EXAMPLES


    # Run a simple prompt
    crush run Explain the use of context in Go

    # Pipe input from stdin
    curl https://charm.land | crush run "Summarize this website"

    # Read from a file
    crush run "What is this code doing?" <<< prrr.go

    # Run in quiet mode (hide the spinner)
    crush run --quiet "Generate a README for this project"


  FLAGS

    -c --cwd       Current working directory
    -D --data-dir  Custom crush data directory
    -d --debug     Debug
    -h --help      Help for run
    -m --model     Model to use. Accepts 'model' or 'provider/model' to disambiguate models with the
 same name across providers
    -q --quiet     Hide spinner
    --small-model  Small model to use. If not provided, uses the default small model for the provide
r
